column4: I heard something like windows can only boot from the first partition or if it's n cylinders from the start, but that's just boot right? I can put the partition itself anywhere?
gparted can
but is that a good idea? Is the read/write support stable yet?
if you want to use win and ubu easily both ways, I suggest run ext3 for ubu and ntfs for win

ext4 still can't be read properly from the ext-windows driver, ext3 can

if gparted needs a 10 min to scan an external, sth is wrong there, either the  connection or it's partitioning
but I see your problem then, if you can't install a fs-driver on the windows side
though you'll lose some nice features, can install ubuntu to ntfs, too
